intro: Salpiglossis cactorum, commonly known as the scarlet bonnet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often hairy and somewhat succulent. Salpiglossis cactorum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators like hummingbirds and bees.
